intro: Guatteria penduliflora, commonly known as the hanging-flower guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Marcaceae and is characterized by its pendulous, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within rainforests, often reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually have a waxy texture, while its fruits are small, fleshy berries that are edible. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
